titleStmt.title: The paradyse of daynty deuises aptly furnished, with sundry pithie and learned inuentions: deuised and written for the most part, by M. Edwards, sometimes of her Maiesties chappel: the rest, by sundry learned gentlemen, both of honour, and woorshippe. viz. S. Barnarde. E.O. L. Vaux. D.S. Iasper Heyvvood. F.K. M. Bevve. R. Hill. M. Yloop, vvith others.
titleStmt.author: Edwards, Richard, 1523?-1566.

publicationStmt.publisher: By [R. Jones for?] Henry Disle, dwellyng in Paules Churchyard, at the south west doore of Saint Paules Church, and are there to be solde,

notesStmt.note: Actual printer's name conjectured by STC; there is a change in typography at F1.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: Paules Churchyard, at the south west doore of Saint Paules Church
